title: Please identify this Deco-sans or something like it
content:
Any ideas? I want to use a similar face for a CD cover.

 [‹ (x) Firewall movie trailer - Citizen {Chester}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184831/http:/typophile.com/node/18188 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Naturnetz.com jaunty little serifed font - Auriol {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184831/http:/typophile.com/node/18184 "Go to next forum topic")
author: toog

comments.content: Is it possible you forgot to include your sample?

FF Bau, AG Book, FB Nobel and FB Agency for  
the condensed. Very close, and similar!

“South Park” looks like either [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184831/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=MSF.123361.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SOUTH+PARK&sampleSize=48) or [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184831/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/testdriver/gotham_light.html), the squarish sans resembles Agency Gothic or Regency Gothic.
Nah, not Regency Gothic nor Agency Gothic... :^/

(Thanks for the plug, Yves.)

[Refrigerator Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184831/http:/www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/refrigerator.html) might work for the condensed letters. It’s very much the kind of thing I had in the back of my mind when I designed it.
